intro: Tithymalus kotschyanus, commonly known as the Persian tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Tithymalus kotschyanus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
